business.headline: Government proposes 5%, 18% GST slabs; tobacco at 40%, relief for farmers: SourcesThe government has proposed reducing GST to two slabs: 5% and 18% with sin goods at 40%, aiming to cut taxes on essentials like farm products, health items, handicrafts, and insurance.

Credit ratings decoded: How a simple upgrade can change a country's fortuneGlobal credit rating agency S&P Global has upgraded India's long-term unsolicited sovereign credit rating to 'BBB' from 'BBB-'.

GST council meeting in September, 12% slam may be dropped: SourcesTwo-day GST Council meetings are expected in September to pave the way for reforms. The announcement was made by the Prime Minister from the ramparts of the Red Fort. These reforms are seen as a Diwali gift for the middle class. Key changes include the removal of the 12% GST slab and rate rationalisation for health and life insurance policies. The government aims to reduce the GST on most items currently in the 12% slab to 5%. This move is expected to make essential items such as footwear, bags, clothes, and toothpastes more affordable. The government is addressing concerns about inflation and the rising cost of living. Feedback regarding health insurance, which impacts the common person, has also been considered. The meetings in September are crucial for approving these changes, with implementation anticipated before Diwali. The Finance Ministry and state finance ministers have been involved in the process.

GST Council may drop 12% slab, more tax reforms in September meeting: SourcesThe meeting comes after Prime Minister Narendra Modi, in his Independence Day speech, announced plans for a major overhaul of the Goods and Services Tax (GST) system.

Claiming bias, same-sex couple approaches court over uneven tax: ReportThe petition was admitted by a bench of Justice BP Colabawalla and Justice Firdoush Pooniwalla, which has also issued a notice to the Attorney General as the case raises a constitutional question.

PM Modi announces next-generation GST reform with significantly lower ratesDuring his Independence Day address, Prime Minister Narendra Modi announced a sweeping overhaul of the GST system, promising to unveil a "next-generation" tax regime with substantially lower rates this Diwali, which he hailed as a festive gift from the Centre.

Rs 15,000 from government on 1st private-sector job: PM's big youth schemePM Modi in his Independence Day speech said that the Pradhan Mantri Viksit Bharat Rojgar Yojana will create nearly 3.5 crore new employment opportunities for the youth.

GST cut coming soon? What to expect after PM Modi's big Diwali promisePrime Minister Narendra Modi's announcement has set expectations for a substantial overhaul of the current multi-slab GST structure, which has been in place since 2017.

India to roll out its own semiconductor chips by end of 2025: PM ModiSpeaking on the country's 79th Independence Day, PM Modi hoisted the national flag for the 12th consecutive time before outlining the government's plans for technology, energy, and economic reforms.

PM's Double Diwali promise, says next-generation GST with much lower taxes soonPrime Minister Narendra Modi promised the roll-out a next-generation GST regime with substantially lower taxes before this Diwali, calling it a major festive gift to benefit individuals, MSMEs, and the economy.

5 IPOs to open for bidding next week: Which is best based on GMP?Next week will see the IPOs of Patel Retail, Vikram Solar, Gem Aromatics, Shreeji Shipping Global and Mangal Electrical. Together, they are looking to raise Rs 3,584.09 crore from the market.

Why your 45-day credit card grace period might be a debt trap, explains CAMany believe a credit card's 45-day grace period means free borrowing time. But as an expert explains, even a small unpaid balance can turn it into a costly debt trap.

entertainment.headline: Top films and shows to watch on Prime Video this weekendTop picks to stream on Prime Video this weekend, from horror to espionage thrillers to animation and documentaries. Here is a glimpse at the new releases to add to your binge-list.
Parineeti Chopra, Raghav Chadha's tricolour-themed Independence Day feast at homeParineeti Chopra and Raghav Chadha shared a glimpse of their Independence Day with a tricolour-themed lunch at home.

Uorfi Javed backs Mrunal Thakur over Bipasha Basu remark: We all said things in pastInfluencer Uorfi Javed defended actor Mrunal Thakur amid controversy over her past remarks on actor Bipasha Basu. She shared Mrunal's controversial clip on her Instagram story. Javed said that we have all said things in the past that we don't agree with any more.

Raj Kundra responds to trolls after offering kidney to Premanand MaharajRaj Kundra has responded strongly to online trolls who labelled his kidney donation offer to spiritual leader Premanand Maharaj as a PR stunt. In his Instagram post on Friday, he emphasised compassion and humanity.

Kangana Ranaut on allegations of going after married men: Ambitious women are blamedActor Kangana Ranaut addressed the allegations of pursuing married men with kids. She emphasised society's tendency to blame ambitious women while excusing men's behaviour.

Farah cheers for Govinda's wife Sunita on her YouTube debut: Most entertaining biwiFilmmaker Farah Khan backed actor Govinda's wife Sunita as she started her new YouTube channel. This came after social media users compared Sunita to Farah Khan. Sunita's debut vlog has already garnered over 5 lakh views.

Param Sundari team brings Bheegi Saree magic in BTS video on Adnan Sami's birthdayOn Adnan Sami's 54th birthday, the makers shared a viral BTS video of the singer performing the soulful track 'Bheegi Saree' from 'Param Sundari'. The film features actors Sidharth Malhotra and Janhvi Kapoor in lead roles.

Ram Charan, daughter Klin Kaara's Independence Day moment delights fansTollywood star Ram Charan celebrated India's 79th Independence Day by sharing a heartfelt video saluting the national flag with his daughter Klin Kaara. The clip captured the hearts of fans across social media.

Kabir Khan marks 13 years of Ek Tha Tiger, remembers debut with Salman and KatrinaKabir Khan celebrated 13 years of 'Ek Tha Tiger', recalling its record-breaking debut and how it became the foundation of the YRF Spyverse. He credited Aditya Chopra for the vision, praised the film's real action with minimal VFX.

Special Ops 2 actor says his debut was better than Ranbir's: They favour star-kidsActor Muzammil Ibrahim has said that he deserved the Best Debut award over actor Ranbir Kapoor in 2007. He alleges industry bias and feels A-listers see him as a threat to their stardom.

Naga Chaitanya-Sobhita make sleek statement in luxury BMW M2 at Hyderabad airportTollywood stars Naga Chaitanya and Sobhita Dhulipala were seen at Rajiv Gandhi International Airport in a recently acquired BMW M2, catching attention with their stylish departure.

Kangana Ranaut says only losers use dating apps, calls them gutter of societyKangana Ranaut criticised dating apps and their users in a recent interview. She called dating apps the 'true gutter' of our society and referred to these apps as a lowly practice. The actor expressed that only people who desire validation and lack confidence go to such places.

YRF's spy universe has a woman problem, and it's beyond bikinisFrom medal ceremonies to midriff shots, YRF's spy universe has reduced its women from agents to accessories. And no, a "women-led" 'Alpha' won't fix a universe that can't imagine its heroines doing anything more than waiting for the hero to save the day.

Mahesh Babu celebrates his 50th birthday with Priyanka Chopra on SSMB29 setPriyanka Chopra and Mahesh Babu's recent picture from the Hyderabad schedule of SSMB29 has created a buzz on social media. The Telugu actor marked his birthday with Chopra on August 9.

Shwetha Menon becomes first woman president of Malayalam film bodyActor Shwetha Menon has been elected as the first woman president of the Association of Malayalam Movie Artistes (AMMA). In August 2024, the Mohanlal-led committee resigned after the damning Hema Committee report.

Anupam Kher says playing Mahatma Gandhi in The Bengal Files changed his inner selfActor Anupam Kher shared his first look as Mahatma Gandhi from director Vivek Agnihotri's 'The Bengal Files'. The actor emphasised the role's deep impact and authenticity without prosthetics.

Sholay@50: Copied From West, Re-imagined At HomeIn the concluding part of our series celebrating 50 years of Sholay (1975), we dive into the heart of a simmering debate: is Sholay a masterpiece of pure genius or a cinematic dacoit, weaving borrowed threads from Hollywood's Spaghetti Westerns, Japanese classics, and Bollywood's own gems?

I travelled 200 kilometres to chase Rajinikanth's magic in Coolie first showSuperstar Rajinikanth's 'Coolie', directed by Lokesh Kanagaraj, released in theatres on August 14. All it took was days of planning, figuring out logistics, and a 200+ kilometre trip that was memorable for so many reasons.

Kylie Jenner enjoys night out with BFFs amid Timothee Chalamet split rumoursTelevision personality Kylie Jenner enjoyed a dinner night with her friends Hailey Bieber and Bella Hadid amid sparking breakup rumours with Timothee Chalamet. Read the details below.

general news.headline: Live: Trump-Putin high-stakes peace summit in Alaska underwayUS President Donald Trump greeted Russian President Vladimir Putin at Joint Base Elmendorf-Richardson in Anchorage, Alaska. The leaders shook hands, walked the red carpet, and posed for photos before starting their high-stakes summit on the Ukraine war.

Won't be happy if Russia-Ukraine ceasefire talks fail today: Trump before key meetDonald Trump urged an immediate Russia-Ukraine ceasefire ahead of his Alaska summit with Vladimir Putin, aiming to end the war and strengthen his peacemaker credentials.

Russia killing people, showing no intent to end war: Zelenskyy on Trump-Putin meetZelenskyy says Russia's attacks during peace talks show no intent to end the war, urging strong US stance and Western unity to push Moscow toward a just settlement.

6 dead, several trapped as wall collapses inside Delhi's Humayun's Tomb complexThe officials informed that 11 people have been rescued from the site and have been admitted to a nearby hospital for medical treatment.

Trump-Putin meet today: Will Alaska bring ceasefire, new sanctions, or surprises?The stage is set in Alaska for a crucial encounter between Donald Trump and Vladimir Putin. Their summit, kicking off at 11 am Alaska time, carries significant implications for peace efforts and international relations.

Tariffing India won't end Ukraine war: US Democrats Panel says punish PutinThe panel said that if President Trump really wanted to stop the Ukraine war, he should punish Putin and provide direct military aid to Kyiv.

Jharkhand Education Minister Ramdas Soren dies at 62Jharkhand Mukti Morcha national spokesperson Kunal Sarangi confirmed the news, saying Soren's condition had been critical and he was on life support.

Standing up for freedom, dignity: Zelenskyy as he wishes India on Independence DayThe Ukrainian president said that both nations share the experience of standing up for freedom and dignity, as well as the pursuit of peace and development.

Partition's Mystery: Role of Nehru and Mountbatten in securing road to KashmirDid Nehru and Mountbatten influence the Radcliffe Boundary Commission's award of Gurdaspur to India, securing a vital road link to Kashmir? Pakistan and historians allege strategic motives shaped this pivotal 1947 decision.

A year into ousting Naveen Patnaik, how BJP battles credibility crisis in OdishaThe Mohan Charan Majhi administration's handling of rising crimes, governance challenges and political perception battles has sparked unease among both BJP leaders and grassroots workers

Putin rides in 'The Beast' with Trump ahead of high-stakes Alaska talksRussian President Putin and US President Trump shared a rare ride in "The Beast" in Anchorage, Alaska, before high-stakes talks on Ukraine.

Putin interested in Trump economy: US President as he heads to key Alaska meetUS President Donald Trump departed for Alaska to meet Russian President Vladimir Putin, aiming to discuss a Ukraine ceasefire and possible business ties if the war ends.

Pak's terror nexus exposed again: Top brass honour terrorist killed in Op SindoorTop Pakistan Army official and ministers were seen paying tribute at grave of Lashkar terrorist killed in Indian strike in May.

What Modi's praise for RSS as world's biggest NGO signifiesIn his Independence Day address, Prime Minister Narendra Modi hailed the RSS on its centenary, calling it the world's biggest NGO. The Congress took potshots at him, accusing him of trying to please the organisation. However, his praise for RSS in a national speech indicates that whatever perceived strains with the RSS leadership might have eased, reaffirming the group's deep ideological influence over the BJP.

I travelled 200 kilometres to chase Rajinikanth's magic in Coolie first showSuperstar Rajinikanth's 'Coolie', directed by Lokesh Kanagaraj, released in theatres on August 14. All it took was days of planning, figuring out logistics, and a 200+ kilometre trip that was memorable for so many reasons.

Hillary Clinton says she'd nominate Trump for Nobel Peace Prize on one conditionHillary Clinton has said she would nominate Donald Trump for a Nobel Peace Prize if he succeeds in ending the war in Ukraine without conceding territory to Russia.

Nagaland Governor La Ganesan dies at 80; PM Modi calls him devout nationalistPrime Minister Narendra Modi has offered his condolences on the passing of La Ganesan. In a post on X, PM Modi called him a devout nationalist and a pillar of the party who helped in the expansion of BJP across Tamil Nadu. He also remembered Ganesan as someone who was deeply passionate about Tamil culture.

Nuns Arrest: After Muslims, Target Christians?On July 26, two Christian nuns, originally from Kerala, were detained at the Durg police station in BJP-ruled Chhattisgarh, accused of human trafficking and forced conversion.

Virat Kohli deserved support at first, not if slump lasts for 5 years: Irfan PathanIrfan Pathan believes that Virat Kohli should have been backed during his initial slump in form but backing him during a later dip came at the cost of the team

BJP Parliamentary Board to meet on Sunday to finalise Veep pickThe BJP Parliamentary Board will meet on Sunday to finalise its Vice Presidential candidate, with the nomination set for August 21 following Jagdeep Dhankhar's sudden resignation citing health reasons. T

US, India united by shared vision: Marco Rubio's I-Day wishes amid tariff riftThe historic relationship between the world's largest democracy and the world's oldest democracy is consequential and far-reaching, Marco Rubio said.

Cue from Krishna for India's Iron Dome. What's Sudarshan Chakra Mission?In his Independence Day speech, PM Modi announced plans for the Sudarshan Chakra Mission, a decade-long plan to shield India's skies from aerial threats. The speech came a day ahead of Janmashtami. Drawing inspiration from Lord Krishna's legendary weapon, the indigenous project will deploy advanced defences to protect both strategic and civilian infrastructure, and will have precision strike capabilities. It will be similar to Israel's Iron Dome.

sports.headline: Martin Odegaard to stay Arsenal captain after team vote, confirms Mikel ArtetaMikel Arteta has defended Martin Odegaard's captaincy after Tony Adams called for Declan Rice to take the armband. Arteta says a squad vote saw Odegaard win "by 100 miles" and insists his team will keep pushing for their first title since 2004.

Did Rohit Sharma pull a PR stunt with SCG Test snub? Pathan breaks silenceFormer Indian cricketer Irfan Pathan said that Rohit Sharma should have fought for his place and not dropped him from the New Year's Test earlier this year against Australia at the Sydney Cricket Ground.

Man United's Benjamin Sesko ready to play vs Arsenal, Amorim confirmsManchester United boss Ruben Amorim says new signing Benjamin Sesko is ready to play against Arsenal, but may not start. United aim to bounce back from last season's 15th-place finish.

Hansi Flick stays confident as Barcelona scramble to register new recruitsHansi Flick is confident Barcelona will register new signings Joan Garcia and Marcus Rashford before their LaLiga opener, despite FFP issues. The club is juggling departures, wage cuts, and squad reshuffles ahead of Saturday's clash with Mallorca.

Venkatesh Prasad set to contest Karnataka Cricket electionsVenkatesh Prasad will contest the upcoming Karnataka State Cricket Association elections, likely in October-November. The polls come amid leadership vacancies and legal proceedings following the June stampede tragedy at the M Chinnaswamy Stadium.

Real Tottenham fans will support Mathys Tel after racial abuse: FrankTottenham boss Thomas Frank has urged fans to support Mathys Tel after the forward suffered racial abuse for a Super Cup penalty miss. Spurs host Burnley in their league opener, with Yves Bissouma back in the squad.

Australia will be big challenge: Steve Smith fires warning at England before AshesSteve Smith has warned England that the Ashes in Australia will be a far sterner challenge than their recent home series against India. England last won the Ashes in Australia in 2010-11.

After Colwill's injury, Chelsea eye new central defender, Enzo Maresca confirmsChelsea boss Enzo Maresca says Levi Colwill's long-term ACL injury is a "big loss" and confirms the club will seek defensive reinforcements. The Blues face a tough Premier League opener against Crystal Palace this Sunday.

Bula Chowdhury's house robbed, Padma Shri and medals missingThieves looted Indian swimming icon Bula Chowdhury's ancestral home in Hooghly for the fourth time, stealing her Padma Shri, President's award, medals, and household items.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.
